title: so my comment was removed because of "dont be a jerk policy"
body:
but the comment i was replying to of some asshole being sarcastic and rude for no reason on a post where i already had my question answered, therefore his comment was completely unnecessary and uneeded and they were clearing doing it just to be a "jerk" which your policy is clearly against, but his comment wasnt being removed and mine was? 

yall are heavily biased on the boards after 2 years of coming here its really noticeable.

replies.body:
It's possible the other comment wasn't reported, or just hasn't been handled yet. We don't have a magical all-seeing eye, so things can slip by occasionally. It's also possible it was deemed to be sarcastic rather than offensive, and sarcasm is tolerated unless it crosses a line into being offensive.

If you ever think an oversight has happened, pop by the Moderation Discord and drop us a link to the issue in question.
his comment flat called someone an asshole

> [{quoted}](name=MrFawknSunshine,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=wOo6iUK8,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-10-11T20:42:05.779+0000)
>
> his comment flat called someone an asshole

Oh, I'm aware of that. I was explaining reasons why a comment may not have been moderated even if it *does* seem reportable to an individual. I hadn't looked into the specific instance he brings up because I'm at work and didn't have time today.

it was my comment. i made a sarcastic remake blaming riot for having the world games at 5am cuz his post was upset on how is he/she suppose to watch a game for the mission. 

i never directly said anything to him/her it was more of a general sarcastic statement where i even said "damn you rito you fuked us again " or something of that nature. blaming riot.

in which he/she replied calling me an A$$h0le which i reported

> [{quoted}](name=MrFawknSunshine,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=wOo6iUK8,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-11T20:49:52.316+0000)-*snip*-

While I appreciate the information, the comment will be looked at and a determination made like we do in all cases of reported comments. If this is accurate, the comment should stand on it's own, and we really don't need to make this an I-said/He-said thing, especially when one of the comments has already been taken care of.
